description.narrative:
Future Forum aims to achieve the following outcomes:
- An increase in the level of policy discourse occurring in the country on a wide variety of core thematic policy areas, particularly in terms of the engagement of students, the youth, women, local grassroots communities, and ethnic, religious and social minorities; - An increase in the degree to which political parties in Cambodia put peoples policy needs before party politics by establishing their own policy platforms based on peoples voices; and - A country which: focuses on the future rather than the past; boasts an inclusive democratic and political system; broadens debate in society around core issues in a manner which demonstrates positive values; ensures that development is beneficial for all; embraces diversity; and nurtures a vibrant and active civil society.

Future Forum is an independent think tank that focuses on research, analysis and public policy. The main objective of the think tank is to encourage intellectual research and thinking, to positively influence the Cambodian policy narrative and stimulate an evidence-based policy debate

Future Forum är en självständig tankesmedja, etablerad i slutet av 2015. I april 2017 inkom Future Forum till ambassaden med en ansökan om stöd (uppdaterad den 27 juli för att reflektera ny aktivitetsperiod; juli 2017-juni 2020). Huvudsyftet med tankesmedjan är att genomföra oberoende samhällsvetenskapliga studier av hög kvalitet, stimulera en evidensbaserad politisk debatt och därmed påverka den kambodjanska politiska diskursen på ett positivt sätt. Ambitionen är vidare att inkludera ett brett antal aktörer i arbetet, inklusive politiska partier, regeringen, statsförvaltningen och det civila samhället. Ungdomar och studenter är en viktig målgrupp. En särskild satsning kommer också att göras för att få med grupper som inte alltid hörs i debatten, såsom kvinnor, gräsrotsgrupper och etniska, religiösa och sociala minoriteter. Insatsen kommer att genomföras under perioden 1 juli 2017 till 30 juni 2020. Det svenska stödet uppgår till 3,3 miljoner kronor (54 % av den totala budgeten). Stödet lämnas som kärnstöd till Future Forums verksamhet.

16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

description.narrative:
From March 2020 the operations of Future Forum were disrupted by the effects of the Covid-19 pandemic as all educational institutions in Cambodia were closed for physical and in-person teaching or training from that date until the end of the year 2020. This led to some difficulties for the training of the young researchers in the way which lectures were arranged and in data collection for policy research. Most of the training however could be conducted through online applications. All planned institutional visits and site observations to various public locations, government agencies, and development partners were cancelled or postponed due to their office closures or practice of social distancing. The organisation identified a number of creative ways to obtain required data for analysis including interviewing sources by phone, social media platform, or video conference device, and administering online surveys through Survey Monkey or Kobo Toolbox.
During this period the organisation continued to concentrate on four interconnected areas of work:
1) Training of young researchers in the programmes Young Researchers Programme (YRP) and Junior Research Fellows Programme; 2) Outlook Cambodia; 3) Policy Lab; and 4) Community of Researchers (CoR).
Some of the outcomes achieved during this period were:
- Twenty-eight articles and commentaries were published in various local and international media outlets (including The Phnom Penh Post, Southeast Asia Globe, and Nikkei Asia Review). - Twelve policy briefs on various public policy topics are being drafted for in-house publications. - Twelve research proposals including the literature review, conceptual frameworks, and research methodologies have been finalised while fieldworks were delayed due to the pandemic. - Various monitoring and evaluation frameworks including Individual Knowledge Assessments have been administered in the YRP to ensure programmatic success and improvement. - Future Forum participated as the Cambodian partner in CIPEs Corrosive Capital project. - Volumes 1 and 2 of Cambodia 2040 were finalised and prepared for printing.
This last period of the first phase of Swedish support to Future Forum proved that the organisation has the ability to adjust its structure and partly re-focus based on changing circumstances and lessons learned. The organisation is increasingly attracting interest from other partners and donors, including Open Society Institute (OSI), Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) Australia, The Asia Foundation, Fhi360 and the Center for International Private Enterprise CPIE.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
